text: Ernest Walter Saunders (born 21 October 1935) used to be a British business manager. He became known in the United Kingdom as one of the "Guinness Four", a group of businessmen who tried illegally to control the share price of the Guinness company. He was sentenced to five years' imprisonment. He was later released after 10 months because he was thought to have Alzheimer's disease. He later recovered. ==References== Category:Austrian criminals Category:1935 births Category:Living people Category:Austrian businesspeople Category:English businesspeople
title: Ernest Saunders
